value.name: 3 WA families on how new police laws could have helped their loved ones
value.description: The state's new accountability laws might not have happened without the advocacy of people whose family members were killed by police.

value.name: Washington’s new policing laws inch toward accountability, when they should leap toward justice
value.description: the city of Auburn settled a $1.25 million lawsuit over Nelson’s 2017 fatal shooting of Isaiah Obet, 25. On paper, Washington might seem further ahead on police accountability than other states.
